title: TEMPEST Call 06: Simulation Environment for Technology Research and Assessments (SENTRA)
agency: Air Force Research Laboratory (AFRL/RY Sensors Directorate)

source_documents.filename: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

notes: This is an Advanced Research Announcement (ARA) format RFP. The main Statement of Objectives (SOO) documents (Attachments 1, 2, 5) are CUI and not publicly available. Requirements extracted here are from the public solicitation documents only. This tests PropelAI's ability to handle Section L/M requirements rather than traditional Section C SOW requirements.

requirements.text: Proposals must be submitted electronically to the Contracting Points of Contact (POCs).
Offerors should email the Contracting POCs at the emails indicated above indicating the desire to submit a proposal and include their company CAGE code.
The Offeror should use a DoD SAFE link to 'drop off' the proposal.
Offerors are required to have emailed the Contracting POCs and request the DoD SAFE link by 16 February 2026, 12:00PM (NOON) Eastern Time.
Cost reimbursement contracts require successful offerors to have an accounting system considered adequate for tracking costs applicable to the contract.

The Contractor will deliver the following prototype software outputs developed or acquired under the experimentation and test effort: Models (including source code), integration interfaces (ICDs), algorithms, simulation viewers (including source code), run-scripts, MATLAB tools, and script tools.
The contractor shall deliver all hardware equipment and non-consumed materials developed and/or acquired under this contract to the Government at the conclusion of this effort.
Individuals must be US citizens and have a security classification level of TS/SCI and SAP eligibility.
requirements.document_reference: Page 4, Section I.5.a Program Security Classification

requirements.text: Offerors must verify their Cognizant Security Office information is current with Defense Counterintelligence and Security Agency (DCSA) at www.dcsa.mil.
requirements.document_reference: Page 4, Section I.5.a Program Security Classification

requirements.text: A Certified DD Form 2345, Militarily Critical Technical Data Agreement, is required to be submitted with the proposal.
The Contractor shall identify their proposed labor categories and labor rates by submitting Attachment 10 of the Call.
requirements.document_reference: Page 4, Section I.5.e Unique Personnel Requirements

requirements.text: The Contractor shall adhere to the personnel qualifications as those shall be incorporated into the SOW Supplemental requirements.
requirements.document_reference: Page 4, Section I.5.e Unique Personnel Requirements

requirements.text: The contractor should use the clause to assure that appropriate shipping documentation is used and reference the contract number to prevent incurring duties.
If an OCI is anticipated, the contractor should provide the appropriate mitigation plan for Government review as part of the Business Proposal.
requirements.document_reference: Page 5, Section I.6.d Organizational Conflict of Interest

requirements.text: Data Rights desired by the contractor should be included with submission as part of the Section K (Certs and Reps â€“ Attachment 6).
Foreign Participation is not authorized on this call due to the sensitive nature of the technology and its level of classification.
Offeror must submit a copy of their approved DD Form 2345, Military Critical Technical Data agreement with their proposal.
Proposals submitted under this call shall be in accordance with the instructions provided both herein and within the basic ARA announcement.
Technical/Management Proposal shall be limited to 25 pages for the Basic IDIQ.
Technical/Management Proposal shall be limited to 25 pages for each Task Order.
Statement of Work (SOW) shall be limited to 10 pages for the Basic IDIQ.
Statement of Work (SOW) shall be limited to 5 pages for each Task Order.
For efforts exceeding $900,000.00, Subcontracting Plans shall be submitted in the cost/business proposal.
Labor rates for these labor categories shall be submitted with the proposal and will be negotiated at the IDIQ level.
The Contractor shall then submit to the Contracting Officer a technical proposal.

The Contractor shall submit a cost proposal identifying labor categories and hours within each category required for the performance of the proposed work. The Contractor shall utilize the labor categories and labor rates agreed to on the SENTRA IDIQ.
The Contractor is not authorized to commence performance prior to issuance of the Order by the Contracting Officer.

The Contractor's failure to notify the Contracting Officer of its intent to reject the Order within 7 business days after receipt of a unilaterally issued Order shall constitute Contractor acceptance of the terms and conditions of the Order as written.

The Contractor shall then submit the following within five (5) business days of receiving a RAC Request for Estimate: submit to the Contracting Officer a technical proposal and RAC Statement of Work (SOW).
The Contractor shall utilize prior agreed upon labor categories and labor rates identified in the basic SENTRA IDIQ.
The Contractor is not authorized to commence performance prior to issuance of a modification by the Contracting Officer.
The Contractor shall provide the nomenclature for proposed labor categories that correlate to the Government labor category and proposed resumes.
requirements.source_document: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

requirements.text: Aerospace/Astronautical Engineering personnel shall have expertise in High-Fidelity Modeling, Software Experimentation and Testing, Model Configuration Management with 10+ years directly related experience.
requirements.source_document: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

requirements.text: Electrical/Electronics Engineering personnel shall have expertise in Cyber physical, Communication, Satellite, Active Sensing, Passive Sensing, non-kinetic effects systems modeling with 5+ years directly related experience.
requirements.source_document: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

requirements.text: Mechanical Engineering personnel shall have expertise in High-Fidelity Coding, Code Testing, Configuration Management with 5+ years directly related experience.
requirements.source_document: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

requirements.text: Systems Engineering personnel shall have expertise in Digital Engineering, Model Based Systems Engineering, Designing, analyzing and Documenting Complex Systems with 5+ years directly related experience.
requirements.source_document: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

requirements.text: MS&A Engineering personnel shall have expertise in Model and Simulation Development, Analysis and Interpretation with 5+ years directly related experience.
requirements.source_document: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

requirements.text: General Engineering personnel shall have expertise in M&S, Data Analyst, Code Development, Software Development, Programming, Documentation with 0+ years directly related experience.
requirements.source_document: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

requirements.text: Computer Scientist/Software Developer personnel shall have expertise in Software Development, Software Architecture, Software Documentation, Deployment, Configuration Management with 5+ years directly related experience.
requirements.source_document: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

requirements.text: Analyst personnel shall have expertise in M&S, Software, Data, Intelligence, Operational Analysis with 2+ years directly related experience.
requirements.source_document: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

requirements.text: Physicist personnel shall have expertise in Kinematics Modeling, Performance Modeling with 2+ years directly related experience.
requirements.source_document: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

requirements.text: Statistics/Mathematician personnel shall have expertise in Design of Experiments, Statistical Methods, Algorithm Development with 2+ years directly related experience.
requirements.source_document: Attachment 8 - SENTRA Proposed Labor Category Mapping.pdf

validation_notes.missing_documents: Attachments 1, 2, and 5 (SOO and DD254) are CUI and not publicly available
extraction_challenges: Mix of Section L (Instructions) and Section C (SOW) requirements
Implied requirements from labor category tables
Less explicit SHALL language than traditional RFPs
validation_notes.test_value: Tests PropelAI ability to extract requirements from non-traditional RFP formats
